topic.title: How to Add a Welcome Message in the WebHelp Responsive Main Page

titlealts.navtitle: How to Add a Welcome Message

body.p: The main page of the WebHelp Responsive output contains a set of empty placeholders that can be used to display customized text fragments. These placeholders are available to you through WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario parameters. For example, the placeholder identified through the webhelp.fragment.welcome parameter displays text content above the search box in the main page.

section.title: Using Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.p: To add a customized welcome message in the main page of the WebHelp Responsive output using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure: Edit a WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario. Open the Parameters tab and edit the webhelp.fragment.welcome parameter. The value of this parameter can be one of the following: A small well-formed XHTML fragment (such as: Welcome to the User Guide). A path to a file that contains well-formed XHTML content. Click OK, then click the Apply associated button to execute the transformation scenario. Result: In the WebHelp output, your custom message will be displayed above the search box in the main page.

section.title: Using a Script Outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author

note.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

section.p: To add a customized welcome message in the main page of the WebHelp Responsive output using a script outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure: Include the webhelp.fragment.welcome parameter in your transformation script. Its value can be either of the following: A small well-formed XHTML fragment, such as: Welcome to our user guide. A path to a file that contains well-formed XHTML content. Execute the transformation script. Result: In the WebHelp output, your custom message will be displayed above the search box in the main page.

For example:
Windows:
dita.bat -i c:\mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.fragment.welcome=c:\myMessage.xhtml
Mac OS X/ Linux:
dita -i C:/mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.fragment.welcome=C:/myMessage.xhtml
